intro: Clermontia grandiflora var. oblongifolia, commonly known as the oblongleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and they bloom from late spring to early summer. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and is often found in conservation areas due to its limited distribution.
